agents.name: next.config.ts

agents.name: components/project-card.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a React functional component `ProjectCard` that renders a styled project preview card using Next.js Image and custom UI components like Card and Badge. It displays a project image, title, description, tags as badges, and optionally a GitHub link with an icon; the card size adjusts responsively based on the `size` prop ("small" or "large"). The entire card is a clickable link opening the project's URL in a new tab, with hover effects enhancing interactivity and visual feedback.

agents.name: components/hero.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a React functional component `Hero` that renders a personal introduction section featuring the author's name, current studies, research and work affiliations with clickable `HeroLink` components showcasing logos and descriptions. It also includes contact information with styled links to email, GitHub, and LinkedIn, each accompanied by corresponding Radix UI icons, styled with Tailwind CSS utility classes for layout and interactive hover effects.

agents.name: lib/utils.ts
agents.description: The file defines a utility function `cn` that takes multiple class name inputs (of type `ClassValue` from the `clsx` library), combines them into a single class string using `clsx`, and then merges Tailwind CSS classes to avoid conflicts using `twMerge`. This function simplifies conditional and dynamic class name composition while ensuring proper Tailwind CSS class merging.

agents.name: tsconfig.json
agents.description: This 'tsconfig.json' file configures the TypeScript compiler for a Next.js project targeting ES2017, enabling strict type-checking and modern JavaScript features (ESNext modules, DOM libs). It supports JavaScript files, incremental builds, JSX preservation, and module resolution optimized for bundlers, while also integrating the Next.js plugin for enhanced framework support and setting up path aliasing for imports under "@/". The configuration includes all TypeScript and JSX files plus Next.js build types, but excludes the node_modules directory.

agents.name: components.json
agents.description: This JSON configuration file defines setup parameters for a UI component library using the shadcn framework. It specifies styling options such as the "new-york" style, enables React Server Components (rsc) and TypeScript JSX (tsx) support, and configures Tailwind CSS with a base color of "stone," CSS variables enabled, and a global CSS file path "app/globals.css." Additionally, it sets up path aliases for cleaner imports within the project and selects the "lucide" icon library for UI icons.

agents.name: components/projects.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a React functional component named `Projects` that renders a section showcasing a curated list of software and hardware projects. Each project is represented as an object in a `projects` array with detailed metadata including title, description, image, link, tags, size, and optionally a GitHub link; these are mapped into individual `ProjectCard` components for display in a responsive grid layout. The file effectively serves as a portfolio section highlighting diverse projects ranging from mobile apps and embedded systems to research and graphics engines.

agents.name: package.json
agents.description: This `package.json` configures a Next.js-based React portfolio project named "asanshay-portfolio" at version 0.1.0, specifying scripts for development, building, starting, and linting using Next.js commands. It declares dependencies including React 19, Next.js 15.3.2, Tailwind CSS utilities, Radix UI components, and icon libraries, with devDependencies covering TypeScript, ESLint, Tailwind CSS, and related type definitions to support development, linting, and CSS processing in a TypeScript-enabled React environment.

agents.name: components/ui/button.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a highly customizable React Button component using the `class-variance-authority` library to manage variant-based styling for different visual styles (e.g., default, destructive, outline) and sizes (e.g., sm, lg, icon). It supports rendering either as a native `<button>` or as a child component via Radix UI's `Slot` for flexible composition, and applies conditional class names for states like hover, focus-visible, and disabled to ensure accessible and consistent UI behavior. Additionally, it exports both the Button component and the `buttonVariants` configuration for reuse in styling elsewhere.

agents.name: components/ui/badge.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a reusable React Badge component with variant-based styling using the "class-variance-authority" library, allowing four visual styles ("default", "secondary", "destructive", "outline") via utility CSS classes for different badge appearances. It supports rendering as either a span or a custom child component using Radix UI's Slot, applies conditional CSS class names through a helper function, and exports both the Badge component and its variant configuration for consistent UI use.

agents.name: node_modules/.pnpm-workspace-state.json
agents.description: This JSON file stores the current state and configuration settings of a pnpm workspace, including a timestamp of the last validation, an empty list of projects, and detailed workspace package management options such as hoisting behavior, dependency deduplication, and installation preferences. It specifies that no custom pnpmfile exists, enables automatic peer dependency installation, and configures the node linker to use isolated linking, guiding pnpm on how to manage dependencies and package linking within the workspace environment.

agents.name: README.md
agents.description: This README.md file provides an overview and setup instructions for a Next.js project initialized with create-next-app. It explains how to start the development server using various package managers, where to edit the main page (app/page.tsx) for live updates, and mentions the use of the next/font feature to optimize and load the Geist font from Vercel. Additionally, it includes links to Next.js documentation, tutorials, the GitHub repository, and guidance for deploying the app on the Vercel platform.

agents.name: app/globals.css
agents.description: This file is a global CSS stylesheet that imports Tailwind CSS and defines custom CSS variables for theming colors, typography, spacing, and border radii consistent across the app. It sets up light and dark theme variants by declaring root-level CSS variables for UI components like background, foreground, card, sidebar, and interactive elements, enabling dynamic theming via a `.dark` class. Additionally, it applies base layer styles using Tailwind utilities to globally set border, outline, background, and text colors according to the defined theme variables.

agents.name: .gitignore
agents.description: This '.gitignore' file specifies a comprehensive set of files and directories for Git to exclude from version control, including Node.js dependencies (node_modules, Yarn PnP files), build and output directories for Next.js and production builds, test coverage reports, environment variable files, debug logs, Vercel deployment configs, macOS system files, SSL certificates, and TypeScript build info. It also selectively includes certain Yarn files while ignoring others to support Yarn's configuration system. Overall, it ensures that transient, environment-specific, and autogenerated files are not committed to the repository.

agents.name: postcss.config.mjs
agents.description: The file 'postcss.config.mjs' exports a PostCSS configuration object that specifies plugin usage, explicitly including the "@tailwindcss/postcss" plugin to enable Tailwind CSS processing during PostCSS transformations. This setup is used to integrate Tailwind CSS features into the CSS build pipeline.

agents.name: node_modules/.modules.yaml
agents.description: This file is a pnpm package manager workspace configuration file (.modules.yaml) that defines the hoisting and resolution of Node.js package dependencies for the project. It specifies a hoist pattern to elevate all dependencies, lists hoisted dependencies with their private scopes and versions, manages included and skipped packages, records package registries, build metadata, and environment details like the node linker mode, packageManager version, store directory locations, and pending or ignored build tasks. Essentially, it orchestrates how pnpm manages and isolates package installations to optimize module resolution and avoid conflicts in a monorepo or multi-package setup.

agents.name: pnpm-lock.yaml
agents.description: The file is a `pnpm-lock.yaml` lockfile for a JavaScript/TypeScript project using the pnpm package manager (lockfile version 9). It precisely records the resolved versions, package dependencies, optional dependencies, peer dependencies, integrity hashes, platform/engine requirements, and dependency trees for all installed packages, ensuring deterministic and reproducible installs. This lockfile documents exact package versions for both runtime and development dependencies, including packages like React 19.1.0, Next.js 15.3.2, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, and their transitive dependencies with cryptographic integrity checks and platform-specific variants, enabling pnpm to replicate the exact dependency graph across environments.

agents.name: components/ui/card.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a set of React functional components that together create a customizable Card UI element with various semantic slots: Card as the container, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardAction, CardContent, and CardFooter. Each component renders a `<div>` with specific data-slot attributes and Tailwind CSS classes combined with any additional className passed via props, enabling flexible styling and content structuring within the card layout. The components are designed for composition, allowing users to build rich card interfaces by combining these parts, with class management handled via a utility function `cn`.

agents.name: components/hero-link.tsx
agents.description: This file defines a React functional component `HeroLink` that renders a styled external anchor link containing a small image (using Next.js' optimized `Image` component) alongside arbitrary child content. It accepts props for the link URL (`href`), the image source (`imageSrc`), alt text (`imageAlt`), and the link’s children, applying specific Tailwind CSS classes to style the link with hover effects and proper accessibility attributes for safe external linking.
